snippet.title: Two men die in separate NSW crashes
snippet.content: Two men have been killed in separate car crashes at opposite ends of NSW. The first man died after his ute veered off the road and hit a tree near Albury in the state's south at about midday on Sunday. The 77-year-old, who police say was the sole occupant of the ute, was treated by members of the public but died at the scene. A second man was killed in a suspected head-on collision in the NSW Hunter region. Police say the man was trapped in his car and died after the collision in Howes Valley just before 2pm. A woman was treated by paramedics and taken to John Hunter Hospital. Originally published as
